abstracts.cdata!:
This study reviews the environmental
            assessment of the Sichuan Urban Environment Project's
            impact on the Min and Tuo river basins area, its urban
            areas, as well as a small portion of the Yangtze river, in
            the proximity of Luzhou. Extreme pressures on the surface
            waters caused by a significant urbanization and
            industrialization in the region, call for an assessment of
            wastewater discharges control. Issues on industrial
            wastewater, agricultural water usage, water quality impacts,
            and pollution control, will be revisited further in later
            phases of the project. Even though the project is well
            formulated and meets sustainable prospects, with potential
            environmental benefits, it does allow for mitigation
            measures in pollution control, wastewater management, water
            discharges, and agricultural water pollution. Mitigation
            measures include: 1) management and operations training for
            staff in the utility companies in a wide range of
            disciplines; and, 2) monitoring the technical assistance
            program, providing both equipment and training for cities
            and provincial areas. Regarding the social impacts, where
            resettlement and compensation issues are envisaged, will be
            covered separately in the Resettlement Action Plan (RAP).
